conclusion: Identify the given values: Length of the conveyor, L1 = 6 m; Speed of the conveyor, v0 = 2 m/s; Kinetic friction coefficient, μ1 = 0.2
Since the cargo is released from rest, its initial velocity v0 = 0. The acceleration a can be calculated using the formula: a = (v0 - 0)/t
Substitute the known values into the equation: a = (0 - 2)/t = -2 m/s^2
Since the acceleration is negative, it indicates that the cargo is decelerating.
The time t to travel from the left end to the right end can be found using: t = L1/v0
Substitute the known values into the equation: t = 6/2 = 3 seconds
Calculate the acceleration of the cargo: a = -2 m/s^2
Since the acceleration is negative, the cargo is decelerating.
The time taken to travel from the left end to the right end is 3 seconds.
The final velocity of the cargo when it reaches the right end can be calculated using: v = v0 - at; v = 2 - (-2) × 3 = 2 + 6 = 8 m/s
The final velocity of the cargo is 8 m/s.
The final position of the cargo can be calculated using: x = v0 × t = 2 × 3 = 6 m
The final position of the cargo is 6 meters from the left end.
The total distance traveled by the cargo is L1 = 6 m.
The total time taken to travel from the left end to the right end is 3 seconds.
